question: A _____ is best described as any unlearned response triggered by a specific form of stimulation.
rationale: New born first automatic response to environment are reflexes and has no capacity to think and store memory.

question: If you were going to check for the Babinski reflex in a newborn, which part of the newbornâ€™s body would you be observing?
rationale: Only feet/toes are involved in Babinski reflex

question: Which of these is not an example of a newborn reflex?
rationale: Newborn babies have no ability to think but can response through unlearn automatic reflex

question: Two-month-old Chucky does not exhibit the Moro reflex. What kind of problem is he most likely to exhibit?

choices.text: He will be less able to grasp objects.
He will be less able to eat.
He will be less able to cling to his mother.
His eyes will not be well protected

rationale: The newborn is less likely to cling to his mother because Moro means normal reflex for an infant when she/he startled

question: Who is at greatest risk of falling victim to sudden infant death syndrome?
rationale: Sudden death infant syndrome is most common in babies 1-4 months

question: Why are African American babies twice as likely to die from SIDS?- sleeping practices

choices.text: They were more genetically predisposed to the disease
They are more likely to have blood diseases that predispose them to SIDS.
They were more likely to be put to bed on their stomachs.
Their parents were less intelligent than other parents.

rationale: African American culture usually share their bed with their parents and newborn babies and use soft bedding

question: Maria is a typical, healthy one-year-old who weighs 24 pounds. Which is the best estimate of her birth weight?
rationale: New born healthy babies weigh 5 pounds to 8 pounds

question: Which child is most likely to be the tallest?

choices.text: Kristin, who has a tall father and a short mother.
Megan, who has a short father and a tall mother.
Kara, who has a tall mother and a tall father.

rationale: Because there is a higher chance to become tall since both parents possess dominant/tall genes
